Class Sprint

    • Constructor Detail

      • Sprint

        public Sprint(javafx.scene.Node node)
        Creates a sprint animator with a node. This node can be changed to any other node later using setNode()
        Parameters:
        node - The element to animate

                      double x,
                      double y)
        Animates the element's scale to the new value specified
        Parameters:
        duration - Duration of the animation
        x - The scale width to animate to (The multiplier value to the original width)
        y - The scale height to animate to (The multiplier value to the original height)

        color - The color to animate to

      • sprint

        public void sprint()
        Play the animation

      • loop

        public void loop(int count)
        Loops the animation. Use the value 0 to run the loop indefinitely. Looping animations usually work best with the ease both interpolator.
        Parameters:
        count - The number of times to run the animation. 0 for indefinite.

      • wait

        public Sprint wait(double time)
        Create a pause in the animation timeline, so that elements can animate at different times. Normally, all animations are occur at the same time. Use wait() in order to move on to the next animation. Use a time of 0.0 if you want there to be no gap, but rather just a transition to the next animation.
        Parameters:
        time - The duration to pause the animation

      • setNode

        public Sprint setNode(javafx.scene.Node node)
        Change the element being animated.
        Parameters:
        node - The new element to animate

      • getNode

        public javafx.scene.Node getNode()
        Get the node being animated
        Returns:
        node

      • isAnimating

        public boolean isAnimating()
        Determine whether Sprint is currently animating or not
        Returns:
        Animation state
